work.name: Robert Bosch GmbH
work.position: Intern - Strategy Consultant and Competitor Intelligence
work.summary: Led the development, automation, and integration of a centralized intelligence platform to streamline market analysis. Designed and implemented a scalable web scraper using cloud-based tools to gather relevant market news and updates.

work.name: Chair of Information Systems, Digital Health – Prof. Dr. Christian Maier
work.summary: Contributed to curriculum development and student assessment by updating the Managing Digital Transformation course content with the latest scientific papers, grading exams, and collaborating on creating a new Digital Health course for upcoming semesters.

work.name: Rox Health GmbH
work.position: Working Student – Data Analyst & Digital Health
work.summary: Facilitated the analysis and visualization of key patterns and trends by developing 4 Metabase dashboards and assisting in building a data pipeline to process over 20k menopause complaint datasets.

work.name: Monet Financial Technologies GmbH
work.position: Working Student – Entrepreneur in Residence in Early-Stage Start-up
work.summary: Decreased CPA by 10% and increased ROAS by 5% by implementing and analyzing a data-driven performance marketing strategy with a five-figure monthly budget.

work.name: Siemens AG
work.summary: Enhanced documentation and reporting for international train projects in France, England, Turkey, and Germany by authoring 15 articles in Confluence and developing 10 Spotfire dashboards to display GPS and status data for over 100+ trains.

work.name: Zollhof Tech Incubator
work.summary: Increased potential private insurance sales for HUK-Coburg insurance group by 20% by developing and evaluating a prototype that addresses five key website pain points, facilitating informed decision making.

work.name: aConTech GmbH
work.summary: Demonstrated potential cost savings up to 25% for companies with 50+ employees by analyzing a pay-as-you-use software license solution through a configurable Excel and PowerBI simulation tailored to each company’s needs.

work.name: School of Business and Economics at University of Erlangen-Nuremberg
work.position: Research and Undergraduate Assistant – Statistics, Data Analytics in R, Analysis, Accounting
work.summary: Improved student learning outcomes in Statistics, Mathematics, Accounting, and Data Analytics in R for over 80 participants each semester by organizing tutorials to accommodate large groups and diverse learning needs.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.studyType: Master of Business Administration - Exchange Semester

honors and awards.title: Winner of the 'YOUNGAGEMENT – The Award for Young Engagement'
honors and awards.summary: Interactive cigarette disposal bins that encourage responsible waste disposal by allowing smokers to 'vote' on questions with their cigarette butts. Installed in high-traffic smoker areas with customizable and engaging questions.

honors and awards.title: Winner of the 'YOUNGAGEMENT – The Award for Young Engagement'
honors and awards.summary: A project addressing the digital divide in education by sourcing and refurbishing laptops for financially disadvantaged students to ensure access to online learning and tutoring, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic.

honors and awards.title: 1st Place Student Ideation Challenge
honors and awards.summary: Awarded for innovative ideation in a student competition about remote diagnosis for machines during malfunctions via smartphone using sound files.

honors and awards.title: PROMOS Scholarship
honors and awards.summary: Scholarship for international exchange and academic excellence.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
